content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    extracted_codes = split(replace(md, "```jl\n", """), "\n\n", "\n"), "\n")
    
    joined_codes = join(extracted_codes, "\n"))
    
    return joined_codes
end
```
This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document `md` as input. It uses regular expressions to extract all code blocks marked with triple backticks (```jl\n```) and removes the code fences.

Next, it replaces consecutive blank lines (`\n\n`) with a single newline (`\n`). This ensures that multiple code blocks are joined together correctly.

Finally, the function joins all the extracted code blocks together with a newline and returns the resulting string.
